edu.govschool.govchat.socket

Class GCGenericSocket

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.govschool.govchat.socket.GCGenericSocket
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GCSocketListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GCServerSocket

    public abstract class GCGenericSocket
extends java.lang.Object
implements GCSocketListener
    Generic socket to extend for use in GovChat. Based on Oracle documentation. Abstract classes must have their abstract methods implemented in a subclass, which will happen in GCClientSocket and GCServerSocket. We define this 'generic' socket, however, because both the client and server sockets share a lot of the same code.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GCGenericSocket

        public GCGenericSocket()
        Empty constructor. Creates a new GCGenericSocket on port 2000.

      • GCGenericSocket

        public GCGenericSocket(int port)
        Default constructor. Creates a new GCGenericSocket on the given port.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to bind to

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public void connect()
        Setup a connection in the background. Later, onCloseUpdate(boolean) will be called if this method successfully completes.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shut down the socket from further use. The socket can no longer accept connections after this method.

      • initConnection

        public abstract void initConnection()
                             throws java.net.SocketException
        Initialize the socket connection. The client and server sockets will initialize different, so this method is left as abstract, to be implemented in the subclasses.
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - the connection could not be created

      • closeAdditionalSockets

        public abstract void closeAdditionalSockets()
        Closes any outstanding connections. In case our subclasses create more than one socket, we'll close them here.

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage(java.lang.String msg)
        Send a String over the connection. A newline is appended to the message for clarity.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to send
